conclusion: Mass of the ball is 1 kg, length of the rod is 1 m, distance from point O to ball A is 1 m, total length of the rod is 3 m.
When ball A is at the highest point, it exerts no force on the rod, meaning the tension in the rod at that point is zero.
The gravitational force on ball A is 9.8 N.
The centripetal force required for ball A to move in a circle is mv^2/L.
Since ball A exerts no force on the rod, the centripetal force must be equal to the gravitational force, so mv^2/L = 9.8 N.
When ball A is at the highest point, ball B is at the lowest point of its circular path.
The gravitational force on ball B is 9.8 N.
The centripetal force required for ball B to move in a circle is mv^2/(2L).
The tension in the rod at point B must balance the sum of the gravitational force and the centripetal force, so T = F_g + F_c.
The force exerted by ball B on the rod at the highest point of ball A is 14.7 N.
